title: Ticket #7735: condor_rm -forcex error message is confusing when jobs are not X
description:
Lauren notes that the error message when using condor_rm -forcex on jobs that are not in the X state is confusing: 

[lmichael@learn ~]$ sudo condor_rm -all -constraint 'ClusterId <= 204850' -forcex
Couldn't find/remove all jobs matching constraint (ClusterId <= 204850)

There were many jobs matching the constraint, but none in the X state. The error message is unhelpful because it doesn't show the extra implicit constraint imposed by -forcex.

Lauren recommends that either

  1. A better error message than "cannot find/remove all jobs ...". The real problem can be known at runtime: no jobs that match the constraint are in the X state. The error message could be something like "no jobs found in the X state; -forcex only removes jobs in the X state".
  2. -forcex should do regular removal of non-X jobs and forced removal of X jobs (i.e., do what the user probably (maybe?) intended to do).
